content.question: A point source discharges organic waste into a stream. Which of the following graphs best depicts the expected pattern for dissolved oxygen (DO) in this stream as a function of distance from the discharge point?

choices.label: A graph is shown to represent the expected pattern for dissolved oxygen in a stream. The vertical axis of the graph is labeled, “DP” while the horizontal axis is labeled, “Upstream” on its left and “downstream” on its right. A linear curve is drawn along the horizontal axis. It moves for a short distance and then moves downward to take the shape of a V, and then continue moving along the horizontal axis linearly. The point at which it moves downward is labeled, “Discharge point.”

A graph is shown to represent the expected pattern for dissolved oxygen in a stream. The vertical axis of the graph is labeled, “DP” while the horizontal axis is labeled, “Upstream” on its left and “downstream” on its right. A linear curve is drawn along the horizontal axis. It moves for a short distance and then moves upward. After a certain point, it again moves downward to take the shape of an exponential curve and then continue moving along the horizontal axis linearly. The point at which it moves upward

A graph is shown to represent the expected pattern for dissolved oxygen in a stream. The vertical axis of the graph is labeled, “DP” while the horizontal axis is labeled, “Upstream” on its left and “downstream” on its right. A linear curve is drawn along the horizontal axis. A graph is shown to represent the expected pattern for dissolved oxygen in a stream. The vertical axis of the graph is labeled, “DP” while the horizontal axis is labeled, “Upstream” on its left and “downstream” on its right. A curve is drawn along the horizontal axis, which moves for a short distance and then moves upward to take the shape of a thick bell-shaped curve, after which it slopes downward in downstream. The highest peak of the bell-sh

A graph is shown to represent the expected pattern for dissolved oxygen in a stream. The vertical axis of the graph is labeled, “DP” while the horizontal axis is labeled, “Upstream” on its left and “downstream” on its right. A curve is shown starting from the top left corner of the graph and moves linearly along the horizontal axis for a short while. It abruptly moves downward to take the shape of a concave curve and then move upward toward the right along the downstream. The point at which it moves downward is labeled, “Discharge point.”

content.answer: A graph is shown to represent the expected pattern for dissolved oxygen in a stream. The vertical axis of the graph is labeled, “DP” while the horizontal axis is labeled, “Upstream” on its left and “downstream” on its right. A curve is shown starting from the top left corner of the graph and moves linearly along the horizontal axis for a short while. It abruptly moves downward to take the shape of a concave curve and then move upward toward the right along the downstream. The point at which it moves downward is labeled, “Discharge point.”

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain how environmental concepts and processes represented visually relate to broader environmental issues.
